org.apache.edgent.execution.services

Interface JobRegistryService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JobRegistry

    public interface JobRegistryService
    Job registry service.

    Keeps the list of Job instances registered by the runtime and provides the necessary methods to register and remove jobs, access registered jobs, as well as register listeners which are notified on job registrations, removals, and updates. The following event types are sent to registered listeners:

    • An JobRegistryService.EventType.ADD event is sent when a job is added.
    • An JobRegistryService.EventType.REMOVE event is sent when a job is removed.
    • An JobRegistryService.EventType.UPDATE event is sent when a job is updated.

    Event dispatch

    If a listener invocation throws an Exception, then the exception will not prevent the remaining listeners from being invoked. However, if the invocation throws an Error, then it is recommended that the event dispatch stop.

      Job event types.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        void addListener(BiConsumer<JobRegistryService.EventType,Job> listener)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a handler to a collection of listeners that will be notified on job registration and state changes. Listeners will be notified in the order in which they are added.

        A listener is notified of all existing jobs when it is first added.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that will be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener parameter is null

      • removeListener

        boolean removeListener(BiConsumer<JobRegistryService.EventType,Job> listener)
        Removes a handler from this registry's collection of listeners.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that will be removed
        Returns:
        whether or not the listener has been removed

      • getJobIds

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getJobIds()
        Returns a set of all the registered job identifiers.
        Returns:
        the identifiers of all the jobs

      • getJob

        Job getJob(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a job given its identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - job identifier
        Returns:
        the job or null if no job is registered with that identifier.

      • addJob

        void addJob(Job job)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the specified job.
        Parameters:
        job - the job to register
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a job is null, or if a job with the same identifier is already registered

      • removeJob

        boolean removeJob(java.lang.String jobId)
        Removes the job specified by the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the identifier of the job to remove
        Returns:
        whether or not the job was removed

      • updateJob

        boolean updateJob(Job job)
        Notifies listeners that the specified registered job has been updated.
        Parameters:
        job - the job
        Returns:
        whether or not the job was found in the registry
